docs.snippet: In Facebook’s algorithm-driven world, a controversy about “trending” stories is happening in a corner where humans were in charge.
The social media company also said it was looking ahead to what it hopes will spur future growth: video and video advertising.

headline.print_headline: Surge in Mobile Ad Sales  and Rise in New Users  Propel Facebook’s Profit
headline.main: Facebook Profit Nearly Triples on Mobile Ad Sales and New Users

docs.abstract: Facebook reports second-quarter profit of $2.06 billion, up almost 300 percent from year-ago quarter; sales rose 59 percent to $6.44 billion; company reports rise in new users and big jump in mobile ad sales.

docs.snippet: A top Republican in the Illinois House who resigned in July after claiming his Facebook page had been hacked acknowledged Friday that he engaged in "inappropriate online conversations" with a woman who extorted him into wiring money to the Philipp...

headline.print_headline: Ex-Illinois Legislator Says Woman Extorted Him on Facebook
headline.main: Ex-Illinois Legislator Says Woman Extorted Him on Facebook

docs.snippet: After killings of black men by the police this week, scores of African-Americans declared on social media that they would equip themselves with tools to stream video live.

headline.print_headline: Critics of Law Enforcement Embrace Facebook Live and Other Video Tools
headline.main: Critics of Police Welcome Facebook Live and Other Tools to Stream Video

docs.abstract: Many in black community say they will make use of Facebook Live and other live-streaming services to record and broadcast unfolding police brutality against blacks, following shootings of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling; video of Castile's shooting has been viewed on Facebook nearly four million times; advocates express hope technology may help change police behavior.

docs.snippet: Also: When you realize you didn’t get an invitation to a holiday party you’ve gone to for years; the complexities of gift giving, and more.

headline.main: Can I Stay at a Hotel When Visiting My Crowded Family Home?

docs.snippet: Egypt does not suffer from war or grinding poverty, but lack of opportunity, permissive Italian laws and the examples of other Egyptian teenagers have led to a surge in migration.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Envy Attracts Teenagers Across Egypt to Europe and Migrant Life
headline.main: Facebook Envy Lures Egyptian Teenagers to Europe and the Migrant Life

docs.abstract: Growing number of Egyptian teenagers are fleeing fishing villages of country's north, enticed by Italy's liberal deportation laws and European life as depicted in friends' Facebook photos; few aspiring migrants grasp either grave dangers of Mediterranean crossing or grim side of refugee life on Continent.

docs.snippet: The Federal Reserve said it was launching a Facebook page on Thursday, part of an effort to reach out directly to a general public.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Federal Reserve Launches Facebook Page
headline.main: U.S. Federal Reserve Launches Facebook Page

docs.snippet: In a video on his Facebook page, Donald J. Trump laments this week’s fatal shootings, of citizens and police officers, and vows to “make America safe again.”

Facebook has chosen a village on the edge of New Mexico's largest metropolitan area as the location for its new data center, an announcement that spread quickly Wednesday as elected officials celebrated a hard-fought win that could have ripple eff...

headline.print_headline: Facebook Chooses New Mexico for New Data Center Over Utah
headline.main: Facebook Chooses New Mexico for New Data Center Over Utah

docs.snippet: Tun Tun Win and his co-workers from Myanmar thought life was fine at the Thammakaset chicken farm in central Thailand, where they reared hundreds of thousands of birds for export to the European Union.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Post Inspires Landmark Case for Migrant Workers in Thailand
headline.main: Facebook Post Inspires Landmark Case for Migrant Workers in Thailand
